title: Ashe ult should have a freeze visual effect like Sejuani's ult.
body: It seems practical, not effecting the game at all, just a nice little effect.

replies.body:
Ashe's bow is magic and makes ice arrows with its magic.

The arrows themselves are not magical, they're just icy and cold.

Ashe's ult stuns due to the impact and shattering of the arrow, it doesn't sap heat from the area or produce a liquid that freezes. This is also why it only stuns and damages one target instead of in an AoE.

No, Ashe cannot have her R be an AoE, it is already incredibly strong.

Visual effect.

not asking for any change, asking for her target to freeze instead of them just getting stunned.

you are trying to argue something irrelevant.

Shattering makes it a good candidate for a stun. The bola is a bad candidate for a typical stun animation because it has an effect in a wide area outside of just the opponent it hits that causes it to shatter. Furthermore it slows in a wide area when it shatters of its own accord, indicating that it has an effect due to something other than it physically shattering.

You don't want parallels between Ashe and Sejuani, they are meant to contrast each other and use their knowledge and power of the Freljord in different ways due to their different interpretations of how their people should live.

the arrow is magic, it was conjured with magic, and its giant. do you think that ashe carries giant slabs of ice? the moment it was conjured by magic is the moment it was lost, and even if the arrow isn't magic and the bow is magic, why does that mean the bow cant enchant the arrow to freeze? I mean, it already does, her passive, it just does it differently, which makes sense as its her ult, the most powerful use of her magical bow available to her.

again, no difference in the actual effect of the spell, the difference is that the target hit would freeze like sej's ult freezes in the area.

no no, you want parallels between them, they aren't meant to be entirely different, they are meant to be fairly similar, with their major difference being their ideals. both of them want to rule the freljord, both of them are doing what they think is best, both of them are using the weapons of their ancestors, both of them use ice in their magic, both of them lead great forces. they are two halves of one side of a coin, with the other side being liss.

I can understand your confusion, but it's nothing more than that, confusion.

This isn't even an argument, it's merely me telling you something and you raging about confused.

It is built by magic, but it is not magic. It is a flying chunk of ice in the shape of an arrow. Its size and velocity are at the level of "silly" but it is still composed of a natural substance with no supernatural properties.

Ashe's passive causes a slow because the arrows are cold. Being hit by cold things makes you cold and when you are cold you move more slowly.

by being built by magic it is magical, and it does apply magical effects. already when it shatters it creates an area slow which normal ice would not cause, it also is an arrow that does not fall. these two things are not things that normal things do. and also, being cold doesn't make you move slowly, if anything it would make you move faster, I mean, have you ever gotten a chunk of ice ran down your back?

the arrows are not normal, they are ice arrows created through magic. ice arrows created through magic can have magical properties to them, and even if they did it wouldn't even be the first magical arrow that ashe uses, hawkshot is literally an arrow she fires that is a hawk. that is not a normal arrow if you haven't figured that one.

It doesn't create an area slow, that's what chilly mittens do. It merely shatters in an explosion that damages and slows nearby enemies (in a pretty small area I might add).

Have you ever been cold? Your skin contracts and forms goosebumps, your joints and muscles stiffen, your whole body instinctively slows down to conserve energy and instead use it to try and counteract the chill. This is simple biology.

Also, have you ever heard of escape velocity? Satellites orbit the earth and never collide with it.

being cold and being hit by a cold arrow are not the same, unless you want to imply that the arrow causes your entire body to grow cold by some magical property.

also, satellites often don't orbit inside the atmosphere, because that way they can avoid most of the friction. ashes arrow does not operate under the same principle.
Guys, you're missing a very important fact.  The name of the ability is enchanted crystal arrow.  It's in the name of the ability that the arrow is magic (or enchanted)

It does AP dmg, case closed

Um, Ashe's Crystal Arrow has always done damage in an AOE (half the damage dealt to the primary target). Only the stun portion is single-target.

A purely visual change would help to clarify exactly who took the hit if two champions are extremely close together when the arrow makes contact.

Hey, I'd be stunned from a concussion too if a _giant fucking arrow made of ice_ hit me in the face.

I'd also probably be suffering from severe puncture wounds, hypothermia, and possibly frostbite, but you know. Concussions are bad and stuff.

You're underthinking this, it's better clarity as well.  The only thing you have to go on if you get stunned by Ashe is that you can't move and you have a long ass CC timer above your head.  With Sej and Lissandra, you are visually frozen.

Having you be encased in solid ice when you're stunned, and having a snowflake CC trail when you're just under frost shot is great clarity.

In the Official Cinematic trailer (the very first one) Ashe shot an arrow that hit Warwick and encased him completely in ice. I don't see why this visual effect can't be redone in the game when she hits someone with her ult.

It was like that in the beta, then they removed it and we've been stuck with the generic Stun animation effect ever since. When Sejuani got the "block of ice" treatment, I knew Ashe was never getting hers back.
